text: The 2026 United States House of Representatives elections in California will be held on November 3, 2026, to elect the 52 U.S. representatives from the State of California, one from each of the state's congressional districts. The elections will coincide with other elections to the House of Representatives, elections to the United States Senate, and various state and local elections. ==District 1== The incumbent is Republican Doug LaMalfa, who was re-elected with 65.3% of the vote in 2024. ===Candidates=== ====Potential==== *Doug LaMalfa (Republican), incumbent U.S. representative ===General election=== ==District 2== The incumbent is Democrat Jared Huffman, who was re-elected with 71.9% of the vote in 2024. ===Candidates=== ====Potential==== *Jared Huffman (Democratic), incumbent U.S. representative ===General election=== ==District 3== The incumbent is Republican Kevin Kiley, who was re-elected with 55.5% of the vote in 2024. ===Candidates=== ====Potential==== *Kevin Kiley (Republican), incumbent U.S. representative ===General election=== ==District 4== The incumbent is Democrat Mike Thompson, who was re-elected with 66.5% of the vote in 2024. ===Candidates=== ====Potential==== *Mike Thompson (Democratic), incumbent U.S. representative ===General election=== ==District 5== The incumbent is Republican Tom McClintock, who was re-elected with 61.8% of the vote in 2024. was re-elected with 81.0% of the vote in 2024. ===Candidates=== ====Declared==== *Saikat Chakrabarti (Democratic), think tank president and former chief of staff to U.S. Representative Alexandria (will not run if Pelosi runs) ===General election=== ==District 12== The incumbent is Democrat Lateefah Simon, who was elected with 65.4% of the vote in 2024. ===Candidates=== ====Potential====
